hints.label: thm-cloning-operator-composition
hints.title: Compositional Structure of $\Psi_{\text{clone}}$
hints.content:
6179: :label: thm-cloning-operator-composition
6180: 
6181: The cloning operator admits the following compositional representation:
6182: 
6183: $$
6184: \Psi_{\text{clone}}(S, \cdot) = \int_{\mathbf{d}} \int_{\mathbf{c}, \mathbf{a}} \Psi_{\text{update}}(S, \mathbf{c}, \mathbf{a}, \cdot) \, dP_{\text{decision}}(S, \mathbf{V}_{\text{fit}}(\mathbf{d}), \mathbf{c}, \mathbf{a}) \, dP_{\text{measure}}(S, \mathbf{d})
6185: $$
6186: 
6187: where:
6188: - $P_{\text{measure}}(S, \cdot)$ is the distribution of raw distance vectors from $\Psi_{\text{measure}}$
6189: - $\mathbf{V}_{\text{fit}}(\mathbf{d})$ is the deterministic fitness vector from $\Psi_{\text{fitness}}$ given $S$ and $\mathbf{d}$
6190: - $P_{\text{decision}}(S, \mathbf{V}_{\text{fit}}, \cdot)$ is the joint distribution of companion assignments and actions
6191: - $\Psi_{\text{update}}(S, \mathbf{c}, \mathbf{a}, \cdot)$ is the (possibly stochastic) output distribution given the actions
6192: 
6193: This composition is a proper Markov kernel: for any measurable set $A \subseteq \Sigma_N$,
6194: 
6195: $$
6196: \Psi_{\text{clone}}(S, A) = P(S' \in A \mid S)
6197: $$
